name: AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! for the Awesome
description: 82 remastered levels from the original and 43 brand new ones that are twice as fast!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7       Processor: Dual Core       Memory: 1GB       Hard Disk Space: 2GB       Video Card: 3D card with 512MB       DirectX®: 9.0c+       VR Support: Oculus Rift (DK2 Only)

reviews.review_text: My nomination for 'Best use of gravity' in the 2016 Steam Awards ;) This is a light-hearted quick-action title where risk meets reward as you base jump through a floating city, maneuvering through terraces and around buildings while trying to accumulate points.   I think the developers did a wonderful job with this title.  I suggest picking this game up when it goes on sale(for ~$2 or ~$3) as it is easily worth a night's great entertainment, especially when you or your friend are drunk off your ♥♥♥.

Title:  AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! for the Awesome  Genre:  Action, Indie, Sports  Developer:  Dejobaan Games, LLC   Publisher:  Dejobaan Games, LLC   Release Date:  3 Sep, 2009  Lets avoid those broken bones by not falling face first into a building, and remembering you have a parachute on your back.   Gameplay
Not sure if it is worth full price but I had a lot of fun with this on my phone and on Steam. If you have an oculus rift this is a must have.

Nice game. What you do is practically jump off the buildings and do some stunts. Controls take time getting used to but when you get used to them the game becomes very fun. You probably wont play for 2-3 hours nonstop but its really fun for the 20-30 min you will usually play. Oh and an important note if you are afraid of heights this game is not for you as what you literally do in the game is jump off buildings and mountains etc. :)

AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! ....For the Awesome, the Anti-Platformer!! In this game you will do all in your power to AVOID landing on them, as you leave every platform far behind!  I nearly made a mistake with this game (beyond thinking the dreadful title actually said something about the game, that is): I read the reviews. Then I read the awards it's won. Then I considered the type of games I enjoy most: pinball, Puddle, FOTONICA. Flowing, limited control type games. Actually, the decision was easier with more information. And I made the correct one.  WHAT a game! While some call it 'boring and repetitive' how can the possibilites of every building, tower, mountain in the UNIVERSE possibly be boring! People accustomed to absolute control, who have paid large sums to get games to perform in very precise ways, might not understand how gravity, and a body falling at very high speeds, are forces beyond simple control. They should play The Collider, a fine game with a similar basis. In THIS game you are being pulled by the force of an entire PLANET! Control must be earned, and learned....  Basically, after completing some ridulously simple tutorials you are given a building to leap from. On the way down you gain points by coming close to objects, coming VERY close to objects, hitting score-coded, colored glass plates, and not smashing to boney, bloody bits. By succeeding, and obtaining enough points, you will reach awards of 1 to 5 stars. Each star pays off in 'teeth', the currency used to unlock new levels, of which there are more than 80. Teeth can also be used to buy things like the 'flip-it' glove, to either give a thumbs-up to fans, or the opposite to haters. Yes, of course, granting additional points.   Once you have fallen as far as you feel is safe, a player opens their 'fins' in order to glide safely to a smooth landing, possibly on a high-scoring smaller target. All movement is performed by mouse and the ubiquitous WASD keys (or controller.) But one must keep in mind that despite the availability of directional keys, a falling/floating body will ultimately move forward, to the exclusion of most other directions or intentions. One quickly learns the power of 'spiraling'.  You may also unlock tongue-in-cheek 'relaxing meditations' (for significantly lower prices,) or (so far) a cookie recipe from the strangest old, pseudo-cannibal lady ever. The purpose of spending teeth is not just new levels and objects, but access to yet more, since you must unlock an adjacent level before opening a new one on a tall, turning 'level drum'. Prices increase with progression, and only hints are given as to what will be found once a choice is made.  There are also many bits of BASE jumping trivia, at no cost, basically to fill out he wall. A!FtA (for lack of better) does have achievements, but mostly for putting in the time, and only ten of them. Not a lot can be done to actively pursue them, other than sitting in a dark room, slowly wasting away. You know, the usual.  IF this is your game, it is VERY much your game. A marvelous, funny AND fun game. So much fun as to not provoke the rage tendancies that will cause me to 'delete local content' almost immediately. No two jumps are likely to be even remotely similar, since the distances fallen can be great. For me, it's almost as much fun to die as to win. Almost...  (Like many Steam games, offline game time is ignored.) 4tdc
One of the acheivement descriptions is a paragraph long.  10/10

Do not buy this game.  Terrible UI Bad 'funny' menu screens and joke art direction Graphics are acceptable Gameplay is highly repetitive Music is irritating at times Game has a very 'good enough' indie effort  I would only suggest you buy this if: 1. You have the occulus rift 2. It is very cheap on sale (I paid $2.50, still not worth it)  5/10 would not play again.

This game with the Oculus Rift is absolutely horrifying and fun. I highly recommend it if you're looking for a simple time-drain... And I 100% recommend it if you are wanting something to play with the Oculus! It's such a darn good rift game!
This game, on the DK2, is like flying around the matrix, it's awesome fun. A huge rush in a few levels in.

This game is absurd, let's start with that. The motivational speeches, the therapy, the hints ... all weird. But entertaining.  The game itself, the gameplay that is, is amusing and fun. But in short bursts. I enjoy booting this game for 15 minutes or so at a time, that way it doesn't start to bore me. It's still quite unique. :)  I recommend it when it's pretty cheap, or if you're able to get it from an indie bundle somewhere for nearly no money at all.
Strangely fun base jumping game. Offers everything the original has. Maps have multiple paths so it is up to you to figure out how to score the most points.

Really not worth 10 bucks, it's a game you'll play for like five minutes then forget about. Also it tries really hard to be funny but it's not at all  Like seriously the 'humor' is pretty cringe inducing And the menus my god they're horrid

Suffering from bathophobia (fear of depth) I thought this game would make me sick to the stomach. Oddly enough it doesn't and I'm enjoying it quite a lot. Though I have played only 14 minutes when I'm writing this, I'm very happy I can actually play this game withouth my bathophobia bugging me in this game.

This game is AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAAwesome. It's funny and oddly scary, just like the AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA! Reckless Disregard for Gravity. I mean, the name says it all really. Time well wasted.
There's a specific scene in Interstellar that made me think about this game, 10/10

OMG does this game suck. Tutorials don't let you actually DO anything (they're VIDEOS!), and control of movement when you pop your 'chute isn't explained at all ('turn with the mouse' it says - to ZERO effect!). I wasted nearly no money on this, but it was still a waste.
The best game on Steam just got better!

Absolutely bursting with character. I wasn't sure whether I would enjoy this or not, but then I jumped off a building, and unlike in real life, where the end result is an unfortunate mess and a prime spot in the local obituary (or if you made a loud noise, the local paper front page), I found the whole experience to be absolutely thrilling.  It's a lovely example of a unique concept polished well, and given its own crazy personality to compliment the whole thing. Perfect little time waster, with some quite complex manouvres required for perfection, lending itself both to beginner building jumpers, and expert exo-base jumpers alike.  Really, there isn't quite a game like it, it's good.
Quite a hilarious game, really enjoyed it to start out with but started to get a little boring the longer i played. But great to play in short bursts of like half an hour a day.
Such a fun and funny game. I imagine using an oculus rift would induce voiding of bowels though...
Picked this up as part of another bundle, but ended up being surprisingly fun in its own right.

Let's pretend for a moment that you want to make a video game. Let's also pretend that you don't have any 3d modeling or artistic ability whatsoever. How do you resolve a conundrum like that? Simple: abstract art!  This is the approach that the developers of AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! for the Awesome took when developing their base jumping simulator. There's a certain edge to the game, certainly, and it's got some style, but I just can't get over the fact that it'd be a lot more fun if the buildings I was flying past at high speeds looked like actual buildings.  Also, the buildings float, because this is the future. And because this is the future, base jumping is obviously now the way that you're going to take down the evil authoritarian government that somehow took over. Presumably you're angry because of the flying buildings...who knows?  Still, it's fun for a bit as a sort of combination racing/puzzle game.
ya jump off of stuff super fast and its pretty awesome

AaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAAwesome! I've been waiting for a sale on this game, as I didn't know much about it. Now that I have purchased it, I can say this is just great! A Hidden gem of a game.  Now, if only I had an AAAAAAaaaaaCulous rift...  Will be getting for AAAAaaaaaAaaaAndroid aswell!
awesome game ... falling simulator 8/10
AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! - The sound one makes after buing it
This is without a doubt the best bizarre technicolor arcadey falling simulator with graffiti that I've played.  10/10, 5 stars, 2 thumbs up, 4/4 apples, etc.

This games reminds of some other falling purpose game, and i can honestly say a little more work has been done on this. but it still dindt live up to me sadly, you fall and fall and score points, and teeths and you use the teeths to purchase new maps (correct me if im wrong its been a long time since i played it=  6/10

The menus are silly and awesome. The game itself is awesome. Those perfectionists can have a blast while the people that just want to have fun can get 3-4 stars easily. I love games that are easy to play, and yet highly rewarding.
Kinda of like BASE jumping, after eating a few peyote buttons...
I am touching your face now.

Meh. I feel like the title was only put in to make this game sit at the top for your steam library, because they are sorted in alphabetical order. If you want a cheap casual game to play, play a browser game instead.
Opera music. In game contro guides written for keyboard meanwhile I'm using a controller. More opera music. Get out.

Awesome arcade style game, That challenges you, and gets you rather pumped. Story is absolutely non-existent, but who cares. This game is about jumping off buldings, scoring mass points, and just being... well, awesome. Definately worth a look if youre looking for a fun game to pass a short time span.   Loading times could be improved, but then again, I didnt install it onto my SSD.

There is a quote (I believe by Sartre, though I won't swear to it) that goes something like this: We are afraid of heights not because we fear that we will fall, but because we fear we will throw ourselves over the edge.  AaaaaAA etc. for the Awesome is the embodiment of that quote.  The game is engaging, the physics fun, and surprisingly(frighteninglly?) engrossing. Though you will find yourself splattered across the pavement quite often, it's hard to feel like the game is punishing you for trying the tricky shots. Add to it the dark, quirky sense of humor (in-game text for hitting something at speed: 'Your femurs turned to femur paste!) and you get something fantastic.  In short: Little is as liberating as throwing yourself off of a building and flipping off haters on the way down.

This game's really good. Now you may be saying, 'WHY IS THIS?!?!?!', and to that I say 'JEEEEEZUS!' and also the fact that it just is. Maybe it's just that I'm adjusted to flinging myself and my co-workers off of buildings, but it's fun. Now...... I don't know... play..... viju gayms?
a new addiction. these dejobaan cats really know how to make a game- first drunken robot pornography, now this!
If you like to laugh in the face of gravity and break all your bones while doing it, this is the game for you.

In a nutshell, this is fun but also can be frustrating. You gotta control your character as you freefall and try and rack up the best score possible. It's tough but it's fun. A good indie game. 7.5/10.
The menus are hard to understand at first, and just simply don't look good to me. The humor is pretty cringe worthy, too. The gameplay is nice and fun though, so I'd recommend getting it.
This game is Awesome!

AaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!!! My-head-is-about-to-explode-for-the-Awesome-ness!   In a more serious note, the game controls are precise, gameplay itself is refreshing, and the in-game comments are quite funny. If you are looking for something refreshing, or just a bit nuts, you've found the right game!
This game becomes very old very VERY fast. I wouldn't recommend it, not even to kill some time.

AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH WHY DID I JUST JUMP OFF OF A BUILDING FLOATING PROBABLY ABOVE THE STRATOSPHERE  AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH THERE IS SO MUCH TO DODGE IM GOING TO DIIIEEEEE UP HERE AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH Oh hey there people watching me :) AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH I THINK I SEE THE FLOOR OH PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF GOD HIT THE RIGHT SPOT AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH IM ALMOST THERE BUT IM MOVING SO DAMN FAST CAN I EVEN DO THIS? AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH Oh.. I did it... (deep breath)   That was awesome...

A thoroughly unique and enjoyable game with so many levels that I'll probably never play them all. Hugs, kisses, breakthrough targets, birds, fans to greet, haters to flip off, and buildings to tag give players lots of ways to earn as many points as they can as they plummet toward the ground. One frustration I've experienced is that it's sometimes difficult to gauge your speed and desired direction as you approach the landing area which can make for a fantastic run that you lose because you missed the base by a tiny bit or break all the bones in your legs.  Ultimately, though, I find this game enjoyable in short bursts, just a couple of levels and I'm back to work.

At least this is finished.  Pros: Many levels. Stuff to do while falling.  Cons: Falling. It's executed poorly. Beating levels and overall the whole game feels pointless. Scoring is fairly arbitrary and pointless for a point based system, having it tied to progression is a poor design choice. The 'humor' is physical painful.

Bosses and employees alike often see performance reviews as a necessary evil. Workers fear hearing their performance is inadequate, while managers struggle to find the best way to balance praise and criticism. But regardless of how a boss feels about putting his or her staff under a microscope, regular performance reviews are an important and constructive way to evaluate the contributions an employee is making to the company.  The goal of a performance evaluation is to give workers feedback on what they are doing right and what needs improvement. Frequent, informal conversations with employees help managers to ensure everyone is staying on task and to address quick, easy-to-solve issues. Formal reviews, on the other hand, can carry much more weight, and even determine an employee's future career path at the company, for better or for worse.  Whether you need a template for your formal, written evaluations or just need help starting a dialogue about performance with your employees, here are a few tips for bosses to make the review process easier and less stressful.
A remaster with new levels, Aaaaa for the Awesome fixes the flaws of the original and improves upon them. It also has VR support and jumping off buildings and parachuting has never been more fun!
The best falling simulator I've ever played. Pretty fun indie title.
But your VR-goggles on and ge crazyyyyyy! Love this game! It's just to much fun if you have VR.

It's kinda hard to not recommend this game, in my opinion. Its fair price implies a decent value and its premise is as simple as it can get: skydiving to get points and unlock more levels. I don't have an Oculus Rift so I relied on the good old ways to experience this game (e.g. mouse and keyboard) and, well, it's a nice afternoon-waster.  The music helps things getting less repetitive and as a game with very arcade-like mechanics, it's still quite enjoyable and has some good replay value if you're particularly keen on high scores and competition in general. I find the menu design to be a little cluttered and of poor taste sometimes, but it's just me being picky anyway.  The 'in-your-face'-ness factor kinda works on this game, and I think it's worth your wallet, especially now that is on sale.
The wonderfully titled title returns with new levels and massively improved eye-candy, worth buying even if you got it first time around. Can import the previous save data!
Bargain-priced title with plenty of content, a lot of excitement, and a satisfyingly high yet not-frustrating difficulty level. Buy this if you like speed and challenge in your games.
The name says it all!
This game is like basejumping without all of the broken bones and fractured skulls!
An Acrophobia's worst nightmare
If you like hugs and kisses, simple geometric figures and always wanted to know what it's like to skydive, then by all means buy this game.
This is a building-kissing-whilst-free-falling simulator. You'll have to figure out if it appeals to you yourself.
Fun digital experiance with skydiving and proximity diving. its worth being picked up.
I really like humor of this game in text and pictures. I'd love to try it in VR set, I guess, it should be awesome.
Not bad but gets repetitive real quick. I'd give it a neutral rating if I could.
I enjoy the dumb music, judiciously added mechanics and general zaniness.
Who deosn't like going fast and scoring points? Oh, and breaking glass with your face, and birds.  It's basejumping in an abstract world with a twisted sense of humor. What's not to love?

This is a great game for a couple reasons. 1. It's unique and 2. This game is outstanding in VR. I dont have an Oculus (YET!) but I got this working in stereoscopic 3D with my Emagin Z800's and it is mindblowing :) If you plan on geting an Oculus this is a must buy!  You will look over the edge and feel parts start to pucker. Then you will jump.   Will jump again..
Really scratches that THPS high-score itch. A lot of fun and an original concept!
